title: Juan Carlos Ferrero
summary: Juan Carlos Ferrero Donat (Spanish pronunciation: [xwaŋ ˈkaɾlos feˈreɾo ðoˈnat];[lower-alpha 1] born 12 February 1980) is a Spanish former world No. 1 tennis player. He won the men's singles title at the 2003 French Open, and in September of that year became the 21st player to hold the top ranking - for eight weeks. He was runner-up at the 2002 French Open and 2003 US Open. He was nicknamed "Mosquito" for his speed and slender physical build. Ferrero retired from professional tennis following the 2012 Valencia Open,[1] returning for a brief doubles stint in 2017.
